news_header: Steve Bannon, former advisor to Donald Trump, has been released from prison after serving four months for contempt of Congress.
news_text: Steve Bannon, a key figure in Donald Trump's 2016 campaign, was released from a Connecticut prison after serving four months for contempt of Congress related to the January 6 Capitol riot investigation. Upon his release, Bannon expressed that American politics has become increasingly divisive and announced plans to resume hosting his podcast, 'War Room.' He has maintained his loyalty to Trump and criticized Democratic leaders, claiming to be a political prisoner. Bannon is also facing additional legal issues, including charges of money laundering and fraud, to which he has pleaded not guilty.
